children: A 45-year-old man who works in food preparation is evaluated for a chronic skin condition confined to the palmar surfaces of his hands.
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

The most likely diagnosis is hand dermatitis, which is characterized by pruritic, erythematous plaques on the palmar and dorsal hands and can lead to fissuring and lichenification over time. Hand dermatitis often results from a combination of causes, such as excessive hand washing, contact dermatitis, atopic dermatitis, or dyshidrotic eczema (pompholyx). It is commonly seen in patients who have jobs involving frequent or prolonged exposure to water, chemicals, and occlusive gloves (health care, house cleaning, food preparation, hairstyling).
